The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Agora \Ag"o*ra\ ([a^]g"[-o]*r[.a]), n. [Gr. 'agora`.] An assembly; hence, the place of assembly, especially the market place, in an ancient Greek city. [1913 Webster] ||
agora n 1: 100 agorot equal 1 shekel 2: the marketplace in ancient Greece 3: a place of assembly for the people in ancient Greece [syn: {forum}, {public square}] [also: {agorae} (pl)]
